intro: Belloa wurdackiana, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and hairy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. Belloa wurdackiana typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to full sunlight. Its botanical features make it an important component of desert ecosystems.
